awards.title: 2019 Tech Playmaker award recipient
awards.description: The Playmaker Awards recognizes and celebrate women who are transforming businesses, industries, and communities through technology and inspiring the next generation of female tech leaders. I received honors in 2019 in recognition of my achievements in designing one of the most diverse and inclusive orgs in our Tech department.

projects.description: Conceptualized and launched B.Well, an internal portal used in all 200+ Booking.com offices. This tool provides support in addressing topics around mental health and wellbeing for our 17,000+ employees worldwide

contributors.headline: Founder of Tudy's Kitchen Ice Cream | Brand Storyteller | Senior UX Advisor + Consultant | Booking.com Alumna

projects.title: Copy experiment tooling launch
projects.description: Launched Booking.com’s copy experiment tool: this proved to be the single-most effective way in putting full autonomy in our copywriter’s hands to run their own A/B tests. Giving our writers direct access to data generated from these experiments, and facilitating the means to showcase how their content influenced customer behavior, played an undeniable role in the business impact and community growth we see today.

contributors.headline: Founder of Tudy's Kitchen Ice Cream | Brand Storyteller | Senior UX Advisor + Consultant | Booking.com Alumna

profile_positions.description: Advise and consult tech startups around best practices to create UX orgs and to implement strategies based on testing/ validation methodologies
profile_positions.title: Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Booking’s first senior UX writing/content design manager. 

Craft leader with proven track record as both a people manager and hands-on creative. As a senior manager, I exhibit strong project management skills and serve as a subject matter expert on product copy development. As a leader, I focus on the career development needs of my direct reports, the business needs of the company - and how to effectively align the two.

Additional responsibilities:
- Craft excellence: empower direct reports in facilitating brainstorms, experience reviews or other collaborative processes to provide continual direction in copy and innovation
- Communication: liaise effectively with leadership and other areas, serving as a main point of contact on resolving copy specific issues, both strategic and technical, growing the community and supporting new business challenges
- Business acumen: apply expert knowledge of our business model with the ability to translate the “why” behind various strategic initiatives 
- Product development: coach and advise UX team, in collaboration with my design counterparts, on how our craft should guide and support these efforts. Attending product strategy meetings, drafting case studies and creating visuals mapping the customer experience are just a handful of actions we took to make impact here
- Copy strategy/quality: own the copy strategy and quality of execution of tasks, taking full accountability for the successes and failures within my area

This role is new to the company. Kickstarting it required several actions: aligning with the business on the purpose of this role, researching similar positions within the company to benchmark career level, expectations and skill sets, drafting the official job description for HR approval, advising areas of the business where this could add value, developing supporting roles (e.g. UX Copy Manager) to aid in scaling the role at a later phase.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager (UX Writing/Content Design)

profile_positions.description:
Co-founded Booking.com’s employee resource group, B.Bold, which focuses on BIPOC diversity in our internal and external communities. Our mission is to support, retain and grow black employees into future leaders at Booking.com. We aim to foster an inclusive environment for all. Our vision is to empower black travelers to experience the world. As vice chair, I am the advisor to the Global Chair and help lead the general body, a team of six board members and an executive sponsor to drive impactful change in HQ and across our global offices. 

We focus on three pillars: 1) professional development, 2) retention and recruitment, 3) internal and external community engagement
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder/Global Vice Chair of B.Bold, BIPOC Employee Resource Group

profile_positions.description:
Booking’s first (and only) copywriter to get promoted to this role. 

Drive technical vision with direct reporting line consisting of seven managers with multi-disciplinary backgrounds. As a Sr. Tech Manager, I oversee the management of their product teams and am dedicated to providing a positive user experience for our customers. This involves constant alignment with the overarching business and product vision of the company, empowering a group of around 40 devs, UX designers, UX copywriters, user researchers and quality specialists, removing  impediments that stand in their way.

Day-to-day duties fit into these categories:
- Business impact: establish measures of team performance based on business and quality metrics (OKRs, KPIs, SLAs), assessing periodically to inform business decisions. Ownership of my org’s design, building the right teams by identifying the right talent, is critical to our success. Applying swift/effective action (e.g. promotions, performance improvement plans, team pivots, re-orgs, etc) to increase performance in a key element here
- People development: manage performance of my tech mangers and their direct reports, assessing their impact by providing multi-source feedback and leading calibration sessions at the end of each performance period. These practices serve to identify top talent, proactively spotting underperformance in individual contributors and overall team output
- Tech strategy/quality: oversee incident handling practices for my area. This includes defining the appropriate monitoring/escalation of errors, warnings and outages. Delegating the execution of implementation is just one way I empowered my teams, giving them the autonomy to fully own their scope
- Leadership: inspiring others by sharing my vision, while creating an environment where they can do their best work, is just one part of this. Showing vulnerability, communicating open and honestly, and leading with authenticity, is what many have said is my superpower
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager (Tech/Engineering)

profile_positions.description:
Booking’s first Senior Copywriter. 

I defined this role through the execution of my daily tasks. I was the go-to copy expert and trusted consultant in my area by peers and seniors, regardless of role. To fulfill the task at hand, I shifted my focus to big-picture thinking by forecasting how my craft would serve in growing the business. This meant becoming keenly aware of how my work aligned with business priorities, critically thinking about how I (as an individual contributor), and my team (as a manager), could have the biggest impact. Solving tricky product challenges, kickstarting community projects and troubleshooting UX copy tooling/system issues was also important.

This role included tasks mentioned in the previous section, plus:
- Dept-level copy strategist: owned the copy strategy for around 15 teams, while positively influencing the product and copy across multiple teams 
- Champion craft quality: facilitating UX copy brainstorms, experimentation reviews and introducing copy peer-to-peer sessions are a few ways I did this
- Identifying gaps in people development: one of the most impactful sessions to date was a workshop myself and another copy leader introduced for training our translators. While most of our traffic saw content in English, the continued success of our product relied on quality localization in 40+ languages
- An advocate for the customer: fiercely customer-focused, championing the best experience by negotiating the right (and sometimes difficult) conversations with the right people. Knowledge of the business from a broader perspective, like understanding the code logic and limitations in our tech stack, gave context in how to navigate these discussions
- Community mentor/role model: exhibiting a leadership style that rested on subtle influence rather than hierarchy is how I got the job done

This hands-on approach gave me the tools I needed to draft the initial job description for this role - which is still used today.
profile_positions.title: Senior Copywriter (UX/Content Designer) & Tech Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Booking’s first copywriter to lead a product team. 

Upon promotion to Team Lead (or UX Copy Manager), I led a small team of copywriters while still writing copy for product development as an individual contributor. From a craft perspective, this included monitoring/tracking trends in our copy strategy, identifying patterns in our successes and failures. As a leader, I focused on the career development needs of my direct reports, the business needs of the company, and how to effectively align the two. 

This role includes tasks mentioned in the previous section, plus:
- Craft: championed high craft by teaching my direct reports how to validate hypotheses via user testing, quantitative and qualitative methods
- People development: conducted feedback sessions, using this opportunity to grow my talent. This allowed me to also identify and promote my successor, serving as a small step to growing more writers into this role
- Team performance: leveraged data to set objectives/goals to guide my team
- Leadership: set the vision/purpose of my team, enacting SCRUM methodologies in coaching them through the various stages of development (forming, storming, norming, performing). Fostering autonomy and empowerment were at the cornerstone of my leadership style
- Communication: promoted my team’s work throughout the wider tech dept., sharing our strategies/trends at quarterly business reviews. Our Chief Product Officer, CTO and other leaders frequented these sessions, giving me the platform to raise awareness of our impact at the highest level. This proved to be the turning point in building the business case to grow the UX copy org to the 70+ writers we have today

The proven impact I brought to this role lead to me becoming the first copywriter to manage a product team. As such, I executed the same duties/responsibilities mentioned above but in the capacity of a tech manager. This expanded my list of direct reports from copywriters to developers and the greater UX community.
profile_positions.title: Copywriter (UX/Content Designer) & Tech Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
One of Booking’s first copywriters in the tech department. 

I heavily focused on micro copy aimed at driving conversion, editorial consistency and site optimisation in a data-driven environment. As the voice of the product, I owned the end-to-end journey of my copy, from its creation to translation and performance, including running and analyzing my own A/B tests. To engage our global audience, content localisation is a key component of this role. Behavioral marketing tactics, like social proof, scarcity and urgency, are just a handful of techniques employed to achieve this. Accurately estimating the effort and impact of my work, explaining the logic behind my copy strategy, is what allowed us to deliver our product to millions of customers worldwide.

Additional responsibilities: 
- Enact SCRUM methodology while working within a department consisting of 300+ developers, UX designers and e-commerce product owners
- Analyze data collected from A/B tests, looking to key metrics for building short to long term copy strategies and generating future experimentation ideas
- Create and present workshops on copywriting for e-commerce and mobile
- Interview and onboard new UX copywriters in an agile setting
- Oversee translation/localization efforts in 40+ languages, ensuring editorial consistency across desktop and mobile devices
profile_positions.title: Copywriter (UX/Content Designer)

profile_positions.description: Lead strategic and tactical execution for Industrial Marketing discipline for TomTom Automotive. Responsible for developing strategies, maintaining client relationships, identifying new opportunities, and initiating creative assignments for EMEA and North America. Projects include corporate presentations, product training materials, digital campaigns, websites, and social media strategies.
profile_positions.title: Advertising Account Manager (consultant)

profile_positions.description: Develop original copy and content on behalf of the assigned client. Copy to be used on blogs, social media pages for various marketing and promotional purposes.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Consultant/Copywriter

profile_positions.description: Plan, strategize, and manage the production of online and new media creative materials. Central focus on creating dynamic digital content for brands to use on the Web and social media outlets. Projects include websites, video production, e-newsletters, and other digital creative. Main point of contact for clients, suggesting best practices for boosting their online presence, while utilizing new media to maximize exposure.
profile_positions.title: Advertising/Marketing Account Manager - International Operations (consultant)

profile_positions.description: Manage online marketing campaigns, while contributing to corporate branding/communication efforts via new media outlets. Responsible for content/creative development, keep branding message consistent across all media, ensuring quality, and delivering projects on time and under costs. Projects included e-blasts, landing pages, corporate community/social networking site, digital lookbooks, and asset management on e-com site. Creative elements repurposed for offline marketing materials.
profile_positions.title: Advertising Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Oversee content and creative development for digital marketing materials - websites, landing pages, e-blasts, static and rich media banner ads - and online advertising campaigns. Responsible for identifying risks, ensuring quality, and delivering projects on time and under costs. Internal and client communications streamlined via creative briefs, call reports, status calls, and production/media schedules. Creative elements occasionally repurposed for offline advertising materials.  Accounts: Viceroy Hotels Anguilla, The Tides South Beach, Renaissance Hotels, AAA Automotive Group
profile_positions.title: Advertising Account Executive (consultant)

profile_positions.description: Orchestrate creative production for online materials from A to Z. Responsible for planning, executing, and reporting strategic marketing and communication efforts via creative briefs, call reports, and production/media schedules. Projects included mircosites, landing pages, and corporate branded site updates. Accounts: Nissan, Jiffy Lube
profile_positions.title: Advertising Account Executive

profile_positions.description: Coordinate sponsorship events and ad content development for integrated marketing campaigns. Heavy focus on broadcast and offline advertising.  Point of contact for key client personnel, media partners, internal communications, and vendors. Accounts: Dodge, Chrysler, Jeep (DaimlerChrysler)
profile_positions.title: Advertising Assistant Account Executive
